info.description:
### EOSIO Contract API
*Made with ♥️ by [pink.gg](https://pink.gg/)*
#### Current Chain: wax-mainnet
#### Provided by: [Zeptagram](https://zeptagram.com)
info.title: EOSIO Contract API

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

parameters.name: match
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on template data

parameters.name: match_immutable_name
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on asset immutable data

parameters.name: match_mutable_name
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on asset mutable data

parameters.name: collection_blacklist
parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_whitelist
parameters.description: Show only results from specific collections. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: only_duplicate_templates
parameters.description: Show only duplicate assets grouped by template

parameters.name: has_backed_tokens
parameters.description: Show only assets that are backed by a token

parameters.name: authorized_account
parameters.description: Filter for assets the provided account can edit.

parameters.name: template_whitelist
parameters.description: Filter for multiple template ids split by ","

parameters.name: template_blacklist
parameters.description: Dont include specific template ids split by ","

parameters.name: hide_templates_by_accounts
parameters.description: Dont templates that are owned by an account

parameters.name: hide_offers
parameters.description: Hide assets which are used in an offer

parameters.name: collection_blacklist
parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_whitelist
parameters.description: Show only results from specific collections. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: lower_bound
parameters.description: lower bound of primary key (value included)

parameters.name: upper_bound
parameters.description: upper bound of primary key (value excluded)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show results before this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Only show results after this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

parameters.name: match
parameters.description: Search for input in collection name

parameters.name: authorized_account
parameters.description: Filter for collections which the provided account can use to create assets

parameters.name: notify_account
parameters.description: Filter for collections where the provided account is notified

parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.description: Filter for schemas the provided account can edit

get.summary: Get stats about a specific schema

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

parameters.name: collection_name
parameters.description: Get all templates within the collection

parameters.name: schema_name
parameters.description: Get all templates which implement that schema

parameters.name: has_assets
parameters.description: Only show templates with existing supply > 0

parameters.name: authorized_account
parameters.description: Filter for templates the provided account can use

parameters.name: collection_blacklist
parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_whitelist
parameters.description: Show only results from specific collections. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: lower_bound
parameters.description: lower bound of primary key (value included)

parameters.name: upper_bound
parameters.description: upper bound of primary key (value excluded)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show results before this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Only show results after this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

get.summary: Get stats about a specific template

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Notified account (can be sender or recipient) - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by Offer State (0: PENDING - Offer created and valid, 1: INVALID - Assets are missing because ownership has changed, 2: UNKNOWN - Offer is not valid anymore, 3: ACCEPTED - Offer was accepted, 4: DECLINED - Offer was declined by recipient, 5: CANCELLED - Offer was canceled by sender) - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: is_recipient_contract
parameters.description: Filter offers where recipient is a contract

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: only offers which contain this asset_id - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: only offers which contain assets of this template - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: schema_name
parameters.description: only offers which contain assets of this schema - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_name
parameters.description: only offers which contain assets of this collection - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: account_whitelist
parameters.description: Only offers which are sent by one of these accounts

parameters.name: account_blacklist
parameters.description: Exclude offers which are sent by one of these accounts

parameters.name: sender_asset_whitelist
parameters.description: Only offers which contain these assets

parameters.name: sender_asset_blacklist
parameters.description: Exclude offers which contain these assets

parameters.name: recipient_asset_whitelist
parameters.description: Only offers which contain these assets

parameters.name: recipient_asset_blacklist
parameters.description: Exclude offers which contain these assets

parameters.name: hide_contracts
parameters.description: dont show offers from or to accounts that have code deployed

parameters.name: lower_bound
parameters.description: lower bound of primary key (value included)

parameters.name: upper_bound
parameters.description: upper bound of primary key (value excluded)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show results before this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Only show results after this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

get.summary: Get general information about the API and the connected contract

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by sale state (0: WAITING - Sale created but offer was not send yet, 1: LISTED - Assets for sale, 2: CANCELED - Sale was canceled, 3: SOLD - Sale was bought4: INVALID - Sale is still listed but offer is currently invalid (can become valid again if the user owns all assets again)) - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: show_seller_contracts
parameters.description: If false no seller contracts are shown except if they are in the contract whitelist

parameters.name: contract_whitelist
parameters.description: Show these accounts even if they are contracts

parameters.name: seller_blacklist
parameters.description: Dont show listings from these sellers (Split multiple with ",")

parameters.name: buyer_blacklist
parameters.description: Dont show listings from these buyers (Split multiple with ",")

parameters.name: marketplace
parameters.description: Filter by all sales where a certain marketplace is either taker or maker marketplace - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Filter accounts that are either seller or buyer

parameters.name: seller
parameters.description: Filter by seller - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: buyer
parameters.description: Filter by buyer - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: match
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on template data

parameters.name: match_immutable_name
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on asset immutable data

parameters.name: match_mutable_name
parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on asset mutable data

parameters.name: collection_blacklist
parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_whitelist
parameters.description: Show only results from specific collections. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: lower_bound
parameters.description: lower bound of primary key (value included)

parameters.name: upper_bound
parameters.description: upper bound of primary key (value excluded)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Only show results before this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Only show results after this timestamp in milliseconds (value excluded)

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

get.summary: Get a specific sale by id

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by auction state (0: WAITING: Auction created but assets were not transferred yet, 1: LISTED - Auction pending and open to bids, 2: CANCELED - Auction was canceled, 3: SOLD - Auction has been sold, 4: INVALID - Auction ended but no bid was made) - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: bidder
parameters.description: Filter by auctions with this bidder

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Filter by auctions where this account participated and can still claim / bid

parameters.name: show_seller_contracts
parameters.description: If false no seller contracts are shown except if they are in the contract whitelist

parameters.name: contract_whitelist
parameters.description: Show these accounts even if they are contracts

parameters.name: seller_blacklist
parameters.description: Dont show listings from these sellers (Split multiple with ",")

parameters.name: buyer_blacklist
parameters.description: Dont show listings from these buyers (Split multiple with ",")

parameters.name: marketplace
parameters.description: Filter by all sales where a certain marketplace is either taker or maker marketplace - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Filter accounts that are either seller or buyer

parameters.name: seller
parameters.description: Filter by seller - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: buyer
parameters.description: Filter by buyer - separate multiple with ","

parameters.description: Search for input in asset name on template data

parameters.description: Hide collections from result. Split multiple with ","

parameters.name: collection_whitelist
parameters.description: Show only results from specific collections. Split multiple with ","

get.summary: Get a specific auction by id

get.description: You can filter the result by specific asset / template data fields.You can add for example &template_data.rarity=common to only receive results which have an attribute "rarity" with the value "common". You can query specific asset data by using &immutable_data.rarity=common or &mutable_data.rarity=common .If you want to query a non text type you need to specify it explicitly (defaults to text type) like data:bool.foil=true or data:number.id=4 or data:text.rarity=common. Integers which are defined greater than 32 bit (eg 64 bit) in the schema need to be queried as text.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by buyoffer state (0: WAITING: Buyoffer created and pending, 1: LISTED - Buyoffer was declined, 2: CANCELED - Buyoffer was canceled, 3: SOLD - Buyoffer has been sold, 4: INVALID - Buyoffer invalid because recipient does not own all assets anymore) - separate multiple with ","

parameters.name: show_seller_contracts
parameters.description: If false no seller contracts are shown except if they are in the contract whitelist

parameters.name: contract_whitelist
parameters.description: Show these accounts even if they are contracts

parameters.description: Dont show listings from these sellers (Split multiple with ",")

parameters.description: Filter by all sales where a certain marketplace is either taker or maker marketplace - separate multiple with ","

parameters.description: Filter by seller - separate multiple with ","
